alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 11 at 4:32PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 432 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain has fallen. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scottsdale, New River, Cave Creek and Carefree. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
